documentation.text:
@title TokenRecover
 @dev Allow to recover any ERC20 sent into the contract for error
@dev Emitted during finish minting
@dev Emitted during transfer enabling
@dev Tokens can be minted only before minting finished.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "xDFIE: transfer is not enabled or from does not have the OPERATOR role"

arguments.value: xDFIE: transfer is not enabled or from does not have the OPERATOR role

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "xDFIE: transfer is not enabled or from does not have the OPERATOR role"

documentation.text: @dev Tokens can be moved only after if transfer enabled or if you are an approved operator.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "xDFIE: if finish minting, cap must be equal to initialSupply"

arguments.value: xDFIE: if finish minting, cap must be equal to initialSupply

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "xDFIE: if finish minting, cap must be equal to initialSupply"

documentation.text: @return if minting is finished or not.
@return if transfer is enabled or not.
@dev Function to stop minting new tokens.
@dev Function to enable transfers.
@dev See {ERC20-_beforeTokenTransfer}.

devdoc.details: Allow to recover any ERC20 sent into the contract for error

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

recoverERC20(address,uint256).details: Remember that only owner can call so be careful when use on contracts generated from other contracts.

params.tokenAmount: Number of tokens to be sent

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: TokenRecover
